meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>carve</kanji> so the verb version is <vocabulary>to carve</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

You don't have a knife for your steak, so you have <vocabulary>to carve</vocabulary> it using the <reading>key za</reading>g (きざ) technique. You take a key and zag it through the steak repeatedly until you're able <vocabulary>to cut up</vocabulary> some zaggy bite-sized pieces.
